thread.title: Overgrowth in Certain Brain Areas Associated With Autism
thread.title_full: Overgrowth in Certain Brain Areas Associated With Autism - WSJ

author: Daniela Hernandez
title: Overgrowth in Certain Brain Areas Associated With Autism
text:
Brain scans of sleeping babies conducted over their first two years of life showed that overgrowth in certain brain areas was associated with autism, offering new insight into how the disorder develops in young children.
The study, led by scientists at University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill, and published in Nature, focused on 106 high-risk infants—those with autistic older siblings—and 42 low-risk babies. Researchers imaged the... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
